tool.name: Analyze sequences

param.name: length
param.label: MCMC length
param.help: If the analysis results indicate poor convergence, try increasing this value.

param.name: allow_ancient
param.label: Allow ancient ancestry
param.help: If this option is enabled, ancestral nodes will be considered as additional genotypes. See this page for more information.

configfiles.configfile:
ALIGNMENT="${alignment}" GENOTYPE_MAP="${genotype_map}" LENGTH="${length}" ALLOW_ANCIENT="${allow_ancient}"
REPORT="${report}" GENOTYPE_PROFILE="${genotype_profile}"

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
cBrother is software for inferring recombination when recombination is rare.
**Citation**
Suchard, M. A. & Weiss, R. E. & Dorman, K. S. & Sinsheimer, J. S., **Inferring Spatial Phylogenetic Variation Along Nucleotide Sequences: A Multiple Changepoint Model**, in 98 J. Am. Stat. Assoc., 462, 427-437 (2003) Suchard, M. A. & Weiss, R. E. & Dorman, K. S. & Sinsheimer, J. S., **Oh Brother, Where Art Thou? A Bayes Factor Test for Recombination with Uncertain Heritage**, in 51 Syst. Biol., 5, 715-728 (2002) Minin, V. N. & Dorman, K. S. & Fang, F. & Suchard, M. A., **Dual Multiple Change-Point Model Leads to More Accurate Recombination Detection**, in 21 Bioinformatics, 13, 3034-3042 (2005) Fang, F. & Minin, V. N. & Suchard, M. A. & Dorman, K. S., **Bayesian Phylogenetic Models to Identify Independent Recombination Events at Shared Crossover Points**, in In prep. (2006)
